diets.name: Balanced Diet
diets.description: A wholesome meal plan maintaining balance among carbohydrates, proteins, fats, vitamins, and minerals suitable for everyday nutrition.

meal_options.breakfast: Idli with sambar and coconut chutney
meal_options.lunch: Steamed rice with sambar and vegetable poriyal (beans/cabbage/carrot)
meal_options.dinner: Chapathi with dal or mixed vegetable curry

meal_options.breakfast: Puttu with Kadala (black chickpea) curry
meal_options.lunch: Kerala Matta rice with avial, thoran, and a non-fried fish curry
meal_options.dinner: Wheat dosa with tomato chutney and a small bowl of sambar

meal_options.breakfast: Appam with vegetable stew
meal_options.lunch: Chapathi with mixed vegetable korma and a side salad
meal_options.dinner: Roti with paneer butter masala (low oil) and green salad

meal_options.breakfast: Banana or glass of milk
meal_options.lunch: Rasam and curd with papaya
meal_options.dinner: Salad (tomato, cucumber, onion) and buttermilk

diets.name: High Protein
diets.description: Focuses on lentils, legumes, eggs, paneer, and lean meats to support muscle health and satiety.
diets.source: NIN Recommended Dietary Allowances; Nutrition Foundation of India

meal_options.breakfast: Moong dal chilla (pesarattu) with chutney
meal_options.lunch: Brown rice with dal tadka and spinach poriyal
meal_options.dinner: Chapathi with sprouted moong salad or egg curry

meal_options.breakfast: Boiled eggs or paneer cubes
meal_options.lunch: Quinoa with grilled paneer tikka and a large bowl of mixed dal
meal_options.dinner: Pan-seared fish with a side of steamed broccoli and green beans

meal_options.breakfast: Sprouts salad with chopped onions and tomatoes
meal_options.lunch: Grilled chicken or fish and curd
meal_options.dinner: Tofu stir-fry with bell peppers and onions

meal_options.breakfast: Egg bhurji (scrambled eggs) with sautéed spinach
meal_options.lunch: Soya chunk curry with a small portion of millet rice
meal_options.dinner: A small bowl of curd

diets.name: Low Carb
diets.description: Reduces carbohydrates by limiting rice, bread, and sugar, emphasizing non-starchy vegetables and proteins.
diets.source: National Health Portal India; ICMR-NIN recommendations on metabolic diets

meal_options.breakfast: Ragi dosa or egg omelet with vegetables
meal_options.lunch: Cauliflower rice with grilled fish or paneer curry
meal_options.dinner: Vegetable soup and stir-fried beans with spinach

meal_options.breakfast: Scrambled paneer with bell peppers and onions
meal_options.lunch: A large salad with grilled chicken/tofu and a lemon-herb dressing
meal_options.dinner: Steamed fish with lemon and herbs, served with asparagus

meal_options.breakfast: Almond milk smoothie with spinach and a few berries
meal_options.lunch: Chicken or vegetable clear soup with a side of sautéed mushrooms
meal_options.dinner: Cabbage thoran cooked with coconut and spices

meal_options.breakfast: Coconut water
meal_options.lunch: Cucumber salad
meal_options.dinner: Grilled tofu or chicken

diets.name: Low Fat
diets.description: Minimizes fats and oils; emphasizes steamed, boiled, or lightly sauteed foods to support heart and weight health.

meal_options.breakfast: Idli with tomato chutney (no coconut)
meal_options.lunch: Steamed rice with sambar (low oil) and boiled vegetable curry
meal_options.dinner: Oil-free chapathi with bottle gourd curry

meal_options.breakfast: Steamed Rava Idli with a thin sambar
meal_options.lunch: Puttu with green gram curry (cherupayar curry)
meal_options.dinner: Appam with vegetable stew (using minimal coconut milk)

meal_options.breakfast: Fruit salad (papaya, apple, orange)
meal_options.lunch: A large bowl of vegetable clear soup with boiled chicken pieces
meal_options.dinner: Baked fish with herbs and lemon

meal_options.breakfast: Toned milk
meal_options.lunch: Rasam and curd
meal_options.dinner: Vegetable salad and buttermilk

diets.name: Mediterranean
diets.description: Inspired by Mediterranean eating habits, rich in vegetables, olive oil, whole grains, and lean proteins — great for heart health.
diets.source: NIN & WHO India collaborative dietary model; FSSAI Eat Right India 2023

meal_options.breakfast: Ragi upma cooked in olive oil with vegetables
meal_options.lunch: Brown rice or millet with grilled fish/paneer and salad with olive oil dressing
meal_options.dinner: Whole wheat chapathi with channa masala and sautéed vegetables

meal_options.breakfast: Oats upma with nuts and seeds
meal_options.lunch: Millet biryani with vegetables and a side of cucumber raita
meal_options.dinner: Grilled prawns or paneer skewers with a side of sautéed greens

meal_options.breakfast: Fruit salad with a dollop of Greek yogurt (curd)
meal_options.lunch: Lentil soup with a side of whole-wheat bread and hummus
meal_options.dinner: A large bowl of lentil and vegetable soup (dalma)

meal_options.breakfast: Handful of almonds or walnuts
meal_options.lunch: Curd with flaxseed
meal_options.dinner: Fruit bowl (pomegranate, apple)
